steps.description: Customer browses broadband and TV bundles, compares speeds, channels, and pricing.
steps.businessRationale: Telecom bundle comparison typically takes 5–10 minutes due to product complexity and price sensitivity; delays reduce funnel progression.

steps.description: Customer enters postcode and the provider Media checks network availability and eligible speeds.
steps.businessRationale: Address lookup APIs typically respond within seconds; customer review adds time. This step is critical because availability failures cause immediate revenue loss.

steps.description: Customer completes sign-up, enters personal details, passes credit check, and submits order.
steps.businessRationale: Telecom checkout flows are longer due to identity verification and credit checks; this is the highest drop-off point and directly tied to revenue.

steps.description: Customer selects installation date or self-install option and receives confirmation.
steps.businessRationale: Scheduling availability lookup and customer selection typically takes 3–5 minutes; failures here delay revenue activation.

steps.description: Engineer installs equipment, services go live, and customer receives onboarding communications.
steps.businessRationale: Engineer visits typically take 1–2 hours; activation success directly impacts churn risk and first-month revenue.

steps.description: Customer receives first bill via email/app and sets up payment method in My the provider Media.
steps.businessRationale: First bill review and payment setup typically take 5–7 minutes; payment failures directly impact revenue collection.
